reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great book and it has great chapters and words it also has some great details and things.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars U Boat Hunter
reviews.reviewText: They sunk a U boat but in return were shot down. Men survive as part of a crew and relying on each other bonded them for life!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not his Best Work and a Duplication almost of The savage Sky
reviews.reviewText: Have to say this was disappointing in a couple of ways. First it was sort of disjointed and a few more sentences would have completed some of the paragraph ideas. Secondly and more importantly, this is almost a word for word duplication of Bickers' The Savage Sky in many of the pages. Only the names were changed and the way it starts out was different. The Savage Sky was written much better than this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Very good read I recommend this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Story Good-Pace to Slow!
reviews.reviewText: While the story was good and realistic in detail, there was to many characters with wordy descriptions that confused and slowed the general pace of the book. In the end, the story showed the cruelty and chance of war for those that had to fly for hours of boredom then seconds/minutes of terror and helplessness of chances for survival! My father flew PBY's in the South Pacific on 20+ hour missions with similar stories (41-45).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2015
reviews.reviewText: This gets one star because I apparently cannot give minus stars. Just very unentertaining; muddled; disjointed; poorly crafted; jabsolutelya waste of time. I really have nothing positive to offer other than I didn't have to pay anything for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: An engaging aviation thriller with a focus on the characters & operational details of their mission
reviews.reviewText: Air Patrol is promoted on Amazon as an explosive, action packed, military aviation thriller adventure novel. However, I found it more than this; it is a character driven story about both the members of an aircrew shot down during a mission searching for U-Boats in the second world war and the men who set out to try and rescue them before the enemy find them. It not only focuses on the lives of the men and women involved but also provides a lot of detail about operational aspects of the mission. It reads as if you are actually onboard the plane, or in the Ops Room with the crew members and clearly shows that the author has first hand experience of wartime operations.It is difficult to know exactly when this novel was written. The dialogue reflects that of the period (c. 1943) and as such parts of it may be considered by some readers unacceptable today ... but for me it adds authenticity to the story and its setting.So if you are looking for an explosive, action packed, military aviation thriller adventure novel then please bear in mind that this story is as much about the characters and the operational aspects of the situations in which they find themselves.
